alert.note: Alert for Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 11:05PM EDT until May 03 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Sagadahoc and Kennebec Counties. Carrabassett River At North Anson affecting Franklin and Somerset Counties. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Carrabassett River...including North Anson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Augusta. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water begins to flood parking lots on Front Street in Augusta. At 14.0 feet, Water reaches 2 feet deep in parking lots on Front Street in Augusta. At 15.0 feet, Much of the parking lot on Front Street in Augusta floods. At 17.0 feet, Water reaches the back of some buildings on Water Street in Augusta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:42 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 5.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 17.0 feet early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
